multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: equities; Google’s acquisition of Snapseed, Waze, Looker, Photomath and Lookout is likely to lift the tech sector, giving the S&P 500 a short‑term upside of +0.3%–+0.6% over the next 30–60 days as investors price in higher earnings potential.

article_node.title: 5 Apps You Didn't Know Are Owned By Google
article_node.summary: The article highlights five lesser-known apps owned by Google: Snapseed, a free photo editor; Waze, a community‑driven navigation app; Looker Studio, a data‑visualization platform; Photomath, an AI‑powered math solver; and Lookout, an accessibility tool for the visually impaired. It explains each app’s features, acquisition history, and how they complement Google’s broader ecosystem. The piece underscores Google’s strategy of expanding into diverse software markets beyond its core search and advertising businesses.
